write_stimulus_to_file¶

dotsDB.dotsDB.write_stimulus_to_file(stim, num_of_trials, filename, param_dset_vals, create_file=True, append_to_group=False, pre_generated_stimulus=None, group_name=None, initial_shape=None)¶

Write the stimulus generated by (or attached to) a DotsStimulus instance to HDF5 file. A specific group in the file is created if not already present. The group name is either generated by build_group_name() or provided as argument. Then, the px dataset is created within that group. Such dataset has a 2D shape. Each row is a flattened frame (see flatten_pixel_frame())

Parameters

  • stim – an instance of DotsStimulus

  • num_of_trials – number of trials to generate

  • filename (str) – path including file name with extension

  • param_dset_vals – list of unique trial identifiers. Length of list should equal num_of_trials.

  • create_file (bool) – whether to create a new file if file doesn’t exist or not (default=True)

  • append_to_group (bool) – if False and group exists, raises ValueError

  • pre_generated_stimulus (list of lists of numpy arrays.) – each entry in this list will be used as DotsStimulus.attached_data.

  • group_name (str) – name of group in HDF5 file. Should start from root, as in ‘/some/group/name’

  • initial_shape (int or None) – used as number of rows allocated to dataset in HDF5 file. If None (default), num_of_trials is used.

Return type

None
